resources.string: Optional
Skip
MD 610 Photometer
Check that MD610 and its bluetooth are both turned on
To turn MD 610 on:
Press (*on*)
Press (*mode*) to enter menu.
Press (*down*) to scroll to Bluetooth and press (*enter*)
Press (*shift*) + (*1*) to turn bluetooth on.
Press (*enter*) and (*esc*) to return to main menu.
Perform %1$s test on MD 610 and press (*f3*) when ready.
Select the correct test and try again.
Received data does not match the expected test type.
Invalid data received
Incorrect test selected
Select %1$s test on MD610
Test Selected
Selecting the test
Test Instructions
Press and hold (*shift*) + %1$s to select %2$s test and then press (*enter*)
Press and hold (*shift*) + %1$s to select %2$s test and press (*enter*). Select \'diff\' and then press (*enter*)
Press and hold (*shift*) + %1$s to select %2$s test and press (*enter*). Select \'free\' and then press (*enter*)
Press and hold (*shift*) + %1$s to select %2$s test and press (*enter*). Select \'Cr(VI)\' and then press (*enter*)
Press and hold (*shift*) + %1$s to select %2$s test and press (*enter*). Select \'Cr(III+VI)\' and then press (*enter*)
Rinse a vial (10 mm Ø) with the water sample.
Fill vial (10 mm Ø) with 5 ml of your sample.
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*zero*) to perform zero test.
Rinse a vial (16 mm Ø) with the water sample.
Fill the vial (16 mm Ø) with 10 ml of water sample.
Fill a second clean vial (16 mm Ø) with 10 ml of the water sample.
Rinse a vial (24 mm Ø) with the water sample.
Fill the vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of your sample.
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*zero*) to perform zero test.
Rinse a vial (24 mm Ø) with the water sample.
Fill the vial (24 mm Ø) with 2 ml of your sample and 8 ml of deionised water.
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*zero*) to perform zero test
Rinse a vial (24 mm Ø) with deionised water.
Fill vial (24 mm Ø) with 1 ml of your sample and 9 ml of deionised water.
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*zero*) to perform zero test.
Rinse a vial (24 mm Ø) with deionised water.
Fill the vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of deionised water (this is the blank).
Fill another clean vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of the water sample (this is the sample)
Rinse a vial (24 mm Ø) with the water sample.
Fill vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of the water sample (this is the sample)
Add water sample to the 10 ml mark in the vial
Add exactly %sampleQuantity ml of the water sample to the prepared vial. Caution: Vial is filled up to the top!
Remove the vial from the sample chamber.
Remove the vial from the sample chamber and empty it, leaving a few drops remaining in the vial.
Remove the vial from the sample chamber and empty the vial
Remove the vial from the sample chamber and empty the vial.
Rinse vial and cap several times and then fill the vial with %sampleQuantity ml of the water sample.
Add one %reagent1 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample.
Crush the tablet using a clean stirring rod.
Add one %reagent1 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample.
Add one %reagent2 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample.
Add one %reagent3 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample.
Add one %reagent2 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample.
Add one %reagent3 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample.
Crush the tablet using a clean stirring rod
Add the contents of one %reagent1 powder pack straight from the foil to the vial.
Add the contents of one %reagent2 powder pack straight from the foil to the vial.
Add the contents of one %reagent1 powder pack straight from the foil to each vial.
Add the contents of one %reagent2 powder pack straight from the foil to each vial.
Add the contents of two (!) %reagent1 powder packs straight from the foil into the water sample.
Add the contents of two (!) %reagent2 powder packs straight from the foil into the water sample.
Fill the vial with drops of the same size by holding the bottle vertically and squeeze slowly: %reagent1
Fill the vial with drops of the same size by holding the bottle vertically and squeeze slowly: %reagent2
Fill the vial with drops of the same size by holding the bottle vertically and squeeze slowly: %reagent3
Add exactly %reagent1 reagent solution to the water sample. (Caution: Vial is filled up to the top!)
Fill the Nitrate test tube with 20 ml of the water sample.
Add one level spoon of %reagent1 powder.
Add two level spoons No. 4 (white) of Cyanide-11 into the prepared water sample
Add two level spoons No. 4 (white) of Cyanide-12 into the prepared water sample
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl several times to mix the contents
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl gently several times.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl several times to mix the contents. Wait until purple coloration goes before continuing.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and invert several times to mix the contents.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and invert gently several times to mix the contents
Close the vials with the cap tightly. Invert the vial gently several times to mix the contents. (CAUTION: The vial will become hot during mixing!)
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl several times until the tablet is dissolved.
Close the vials with the caps and shake to mix the contents.
Close the vial(s) tightly with the cap(s) and shake thoroughly until the reagent is dissolved completely.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl gently (do not shake heavily!) several times until the tablet is dissolved
Close the tube tightly with the cap and swirl vigorously for one minute.
Wipe the outside of the vial.
Hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*test*) key.
Wipe the outside of the vial.
Hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*test*) and wait for a reaction time of %reactionTime1.
Wipe the outside of the vial.
Hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*test*) and wait for a reaction time of %reactionTime2.
Press (*test*) and wait for a reaction time of %reactionTime3.
Wipe the outside of the prepared vial.
Hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*zero*) to perform zero test
Wipe the outside of the vial (blank), hold vial at the lid, place vial (blank) in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*zero*) to perform zero test and wait for a reaction period of %reactionTime1.
Wipe the outside of the vial (the sample).
Hold vial at the lid, place vial (the sample) in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*test*) key.
Press (*enter*) and wait for a reaction period of %reactionTime1
Press (*enter*) and wait for a reaction period of %reactionTime2
Remix the solution
Insert the adapter for 16 mm Ø vials
Open the NitraX reagent A vial and add 1 ml of the water sample. Close the cap tightly.
Open one white capped reaction vial and add 2 ml deionised water (this is the blank)
Open another white capped reaction vial and add 2 ml of the water sample (this is the sample).
Open one white capped reaction vial and add 0.1 ml deionised water (this is the blank)
Open another white capped reaction vial and add 0.1 ml of the water sample (this is the sample).
Open one white capped reaction vial and add 0.2 ml deionised water (this is the blank)
Open another white capped reaction vial and add 0.2 ml of the water sample (this is the sample).
Heat the vial for 120 minutes in a preheated thermoreactor at a temperature of 100°C.
Heat the vials for 120 minutes in the preheated reactor at a temperature of 150°C. (CAUTION: The vials are hot!)
Remove the vial from the thermoreactor. (CAUTION: The vials are hot!).
Invert the vial and allow to cool to room temperature. Do not place the hot vials in the sample chamber.
(CAUTION: The vials are hot!) Remove the tubes from the heating block and allow them to cool to 60°C or less.
Mix the contents by carefully inverting each tube several times while still warm.
Allow the tubes to cool to ambient temperature before measuring. Do not place the hot vials in the sample chamber.

Stand the tube upright and after the reducing agent has settled to the bottom, gently invert it three to four times so as to complete the flocculation of the reducing agent. Then let the tube stand for a further 2 minutes.
Open the tube and wipe around the top of the tube with a clean tissue to remove any residuals of the reducing agent.
Carefully decant 10 ml of the treated solution into the vial (24 mm Ø) used for zeroing, ensuring that no reducing agent is carried over.
Fill a clean 20 ml syringe with approx. 14 ml water sample.
Connect the syringe to the filtration assembly (using a GF/C filter) and discharge the syringe to waste, down to the 10 ml mark.
Rinse a vial (24 mm Ø) with water sample.
Fill vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of your sample from the syringe.
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid, place vial in the chamber and align arrow marks.
Press (*zero*) to perform zero test
Blend approx. 500 ml of the water sample (e.g. in a blender) at high speed for 2 minutes.
Stir the blended water sample.
Immediately rinse the vial with the water sample.
Fill the vial with 10 ml water sample.
Stir the water sample.
Immediately rinse the vial with the water sample.
Fill the vial with 10 ml water sample.
Add one %reagent1 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample.
Crush the tablet using a clean stirring rod and dissolve the tablet completely.
Rinse vial and stirring rod thoroughly with deionised water.
Rinse vial thoroughly with deionised water.
Once test result is shown on the MD610 photometer, press (*f3*) to transfer data.
Note: Overrange and underrange are also valid results.
In the case of high levels of residual chlorine, perform the analysis with a dechlorinated water sample. To dechlorinate:
Add one DECHLOR tablet to the water sample.
Crush and mix to dissolve the tablet. Then continue with the next step of the instructions.
